commands.name: az network private-endpoint create
commands.syntax:
az network private-endpoint create --connection-name
                                   --name
                                   --private-connection-resource-id
                                   --resource-group
                                   --subnet
                                   [--asg]
                                   [--edge-zone]
                                   [--group-id]
                                   [--ip-config]
                                   [--location]
                                   [--manual-request {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                   [--nic-name]
                                   [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                   [--request-message]
                                   [--tags]
                                   [--vnet-name]
examples: az network private-endpoint create -g MyResourceGroup -n MyPE --vnet-name MyVnetName --subnet MySubnet --private-connection-resource-id "/subscriptions/00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000/resourceGroups/MyResourceGroup/providers/Microsoft.Network/privateLinkServices/MyPLS" --connection-name tttt -l centralus

az network private-endpoint create -n MyPE -g MyResourceGroup --vnet-name MyVnetName --subnet MySubnet --connection-name MyConnectionName --group-id MyGroupId --private-connection-resource-id MyResourceId --asg id=MyAsgId --asg id=MyAsgId

az network private-endpoint create -n MyPE -g MyResourceGroup --vnet-name MyVnetName --subnet MySubnet --connection-name MyConnectionName --group-id MyGroupId --private-connection-resource-id MyResourceId --ip-configs [{name:Myipconfig1,group-id:MyGroupId ,member-name:MyMemberName,private-ip-address:10.0.0.4},{name:Myipconfig2,private-ip-address:10.0.0.6}]

commands.name: az network private-endpoint delete
commands.syntax:
az network private-endpoint delete [--ids]
                                   [--name]
                                   [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                   [--resource-group]
                                   [--subscription]
examples: az network private-endpoint delete --name MyPrivateEndpoint --resource-group MyResourceGroup

commands.name: az network private-endpoint list-types
commands.summary: Returns all of the resource types that can be linked to a Private Endpoint in this subscription in this region.

commands.name: az network private-endpoint show
commands.summary: Get the details of a private endpoint.
examples: az network private-endpoint show --name MyPrivateEndpoint --resource-group MyResourceGroup

commands.name: az network private-endpoint update
commands.syntax:
az network private-endpoint update [--add]
                                   [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                   [--ids]
                                   [--name]
                                   [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                   [--remove]
                                   [--request-message]
                                   [--resource-group]
                                   [--set]
                                   [--subscription]
                                   [--tags]
examples: az network private-endpoint update -g MyResourceGroup -n MyPE --request-message "test" --tags mytag=hello
az network private-endpoint update --name MyPE --resource-group MyResourceGroup --set useRemoteGateways=true

commands.name: az network private-endpoint wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
